summary: This bill, the Securing Strictly Needy Americans’ Pivotal (SNAP) Benefits Act of 2025, amends the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2023. It aims to limit the use of electronic benefit transfer (EBT) cards for food purchases, requiring suspension of accounts for out-of-state transactions exceeding 60 days unless residency is verified. It also restricts SNAP benefit redemption by households owning approved retail food stores or wholesale food concerns, with exceptions for publicly owned entities. The Act takes effect one year after enactment.
